title: Chapter 2: Confirmation
content:
Chapter 2:
Confirmation

FORMAL CLASSES WOULD start the next day, and by 11:30, the first day of the new school year was coming to an end.

No, perhaps it would be better to say it had ended before I realized it.

The absurd news that Ayanokouji-kun had transferred— I couldn't believe it at first, and I still don't believe it now.

It just can't be.

It just can't be...

I kept repeating the same thing in my mind like a spell.

However…

However… this was neither a misunderstanding nor a dream.

This reality really is happening in real time…

I wanted to see him.

I didn't want to see him.

Honestly, I did feel a bit scared about seeing him.

That was a lie. I was very scared.

I was so scared, I couldn't help it.

While continuing the conflict in my mind, I looked at my hands—at both of my palms.

They were trembling.

Just imagining it made my body tremble.

I wanted to stop thinking about it, to reject it entirely.

But… But still—I must confirm Ayanokouji-kun's true intentions.

I couldn't just give up.

After all, I had yet to hear him speak about his true objectives from his own lips.

It wouldn't be too late to make all the decisions after receiving that confirmation.

He might've been burdened with something he couldn't tell us about.

…Let's confirm it.

With only those feelings to rely on, I stood up.

"…Horikita-san."

As if waiting for me to move, Hirata-kun, who had approached at some point, spoke.

Sudou-kun and others were also looking this way.

"Sorry, but can we talk later? I'm going to meet him now."

I don't have the luxury to be distracted by unnecessary chatter right now.

I left without even taking my bag, and with just my phone in hand, I headed to the hallway.

A fair amount of time had passed since the chime signaling the end of the school day rang.

When I stepped into the hallway, many students had already started to leave.

Immediately, I sensed something unusual from the atmosphere of the other classes' students around me.

I didn't know whether there had been an announcement from each class's teachers, but at least, everyone in our year already knew about Ayanokouji-kun's class transfer.

The curious glances directed at me attested to that.

Of course, those glances might've held various implications and speculations regarding my class's situation.

The theory that he was sent as a spy to the other class.

The theory that he was exiled from the class.

The theory that he betrayed us.

Those might've just been part of the countless baseless rumors and mere speculations flying around.

But that didn't matter now.

Before worrying about others’ thoughts, I didn’t even understand the thoughts of my own class, or those belonging to Ayanokouji-kun himself.

Without any regard for manners, I forcefully opened the door to Sakayanagi-san's former class.

If he's still here—

That was what I was thinking, but…

While searching for him, I unconsciously counted the desks.

Although Sakayanagi-san was supposed to have withdrawn voluntarily, the number of seats hadn't decreased.

However, more importantly, only a few male and female students remained in the classroom, and Ayanokouji-kun wasn't among them.

"Tsukasaki-kun."

I approached Tsukasaki-kun, who happened to be nearest.

"Do you need something?"

"You know why I'm here, right? Where is Ayanokouji-kun?"

"He left the classroom a few minutes ago. He probably went to Keyaki Mall."

"I see, thank you."

Then there was no more need for me to stay here.

As I returned to the hallway, I immediately noticed some students smirking.

It was clear to them that we were in the midst of trouble, which was unpleasant.

While walking quickly down the hallway, I tried to contact Ayanokouji-kun on my phone.

The phone rang, but no matter how long I waited, there was no sign of him answering.

Either he didn't notice, or he noticed and chose not to answer.

"Horikita-san."

It was Matsushita-san who called out to me as I was heading toward the stairwell.

"Sorry, but I'm in a hurry."

"I know. You're going to see Ayanokouji-kun, right? Let me come with you."

Matsushita-san lined up beside me, matching my pace without stopping.

"Why would you come?"

"…I want to know the reason behind Ayanokouji-kun's transfer. Just to confirm once more, this isn't part of your strategy, Horikita-san, right?"

"Unfortunately, I have no such plan. Even if transferring him to Ryuuen-kun's class would make strategic sense, there's hardly any point in dropping him to Class C. Now that Sakayanagi-san has left, there's no meaning in joining that class."

"…Right. So, Ayanokouji-kun decided to transfer without telling anyone."

"I don't know. Whether someone asked him to, or he was threatened—"

Or perhaps his heart was swayed by a large amount of funds…

Such thoughts crossed my mind, and my brain quickly understood that they were nearly impossible.

At least, he wasn't the kind of person to be swayed by funds, and it was unlikely that someone of his caliber would decide to transfer just because he was threatened.

It was an unpleasant reality I didn't want to consider.

That meant that, indeed, this transfer was a decision Ayanokouji-kun made on his own.

The worst-case scenario floated to the surface of my mind.

"Right now… I don't want to talk based on mere speculation. Not until I hear it directly from him. So, it would be better if you wait—"

"I'd like to, but I also want to hear the explanation directly from Ayanokouji-kun. He must have some sort of objective that'll convince us… I want to hear it."

Yes, that's exactly it.

I, too, wanted an answer that would have me convinced.

He didn't talk about much with me, or rather, to anyone around him.

That was why he was sometimes misunderstood as incompetent, and some even resented him.

But the truth was different.

Even if he found it troublesome, he cared about the class and lent a hand when we were in need.

That was why I was certain that he must've had some objective he hadn't told us about.

He must've sensed some anomaly or danger in Sakayanagi-san's former class, which only seemed to be sinking.

Or perhaps… he might've received some huge threat.

That's why he went in alone, without telling his allies.

Such… behaviors, like those belonging to a hero in a movie.

Of course, all this speculation contained much of my wishful thinking, but…

But that wasn't the only thing that mattered.

I would've wanted him to consult with us.

Whatever reason he had for deciding the transfer—

Leaving the class without saying anything… that’s just… that’s just…

"Ayanokouji-kun… Why…"

…Am I really that unreliable?

"…Such foolishness… " …Yes, that's right.

Even as I internally asked myself that question, I couldn’t help but let out a bitter smile.

To him, I still must've seemed like a child.

I didn't possess the qualifications to stand beside him.

There was no way he’d rely on me.

"…Horikita-san, are you okay?"

"I'm… fine."

Matsushita-san looked at me, worried; I wondered if my almost voiceless response reached her.

"More importantly, it's about Ayanokouji-kun."

The class transfer had already been officially decided.

However, there was still a good chance that this wasn't his intention.

If that was the case, I absolutely had to save him.

It wasn't just me. The whole class had to come together and scrape up Private Points for his sake.
